environmental_bioconcentrations.References: (1) Chemicals Inspection and Testing Institute. Japan Chemical Industry Ecology - Toxicology and Information Center. ISBN 4-89074-101-1 (1992) (2) Franke C et al; Chemosphere 29: 1501-14 (1994)
environmental_bioconcentrations.Value: BCF values of 36-106 were measured in carp exposed to 50 ug/L of 1,1,2,2-tetrachloro-1,2-difluoroethane over a 6 week incubation period(1). According to a classification scheme(2), these BCF values suggests that bioconcentration in aquatic organisms is moderate to high(SRC).

environmental_biodegradations.References: (1) Sylvestre M et al; Crit Rev Environ Sci Technol 27: 87-111 (1997)
environmental_biodegradations.Value: ANAEROBIC: Structurally similar compounds such as Freon 12 and Freon 114 have been shown to biodegrade under anaerobic conditions(1), suggesting that 1,1,2,2-tetrachloro-1,2-difluoroethane may also biodegrade under anaerobic conditions(SRC).

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ Effect of 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane on pulmonary surfactant studied. IV injection in rats produced acute pulmonary alveolar instability & atelectasis. It can dissolve & displace lipid portion of alveolar surfactant thus causing alveolar instability.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Mackison, F. W., R. S. Stricoff, and L. J. Partridge, Jr. (eds.). NIOSH/OSHA - Occupational Health Guidelines for Chemical Hazards. DHHS(NIOSH) Publication No. 81-123 (3 VOLS). Washington, DC: U.S. Government Printing Office, Jan. 1981., p. 2
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ Instilled in the eyes of rabbits, it produced mild conjunctival irritation.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Gosselin, R.E., R.P. Smith, H.C. Hodge. Clinical Toxicology of Commercial Products. 5th ed. Baltimore: Williams and Wilkins, 1984., p. II-159
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ Early animal ... experience indicated that high vapor concn (eg, 20%) may cause confusion, pulmonary irritation, tremors & rarely coma, but that these effects were generally transient & without late sequelae. /Fluorocarbon Refrigerants & Propellants/

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Rom, W.N. (ed.). Environmental and Occupational Medicine. 2nd ed. Boston, MA: Little, Brown and Company, 1992., p. 1300
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ ... Chlorofluorocarbons could sensitize the canine myocardium to adrenaline, resulting in serious cardiac arrhythmias. /CFCs/

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane  p. 1 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ No deaths were seen in rabbits following dermal application of 7,500 mg/kg to the skin.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 1 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ The lowest concentration at which lethality was observed in a 4-hour inhalation exposure to rats was 15,000 ppm.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition.1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 1 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ An 18-hour exposure of rats at either 5,000 or 10,000 ppm was lethal with extensive hemorrhage seen in the lungs.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 1 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ CFC-112 was capable of sensitizing the beagle heart to exogenous adrenalin at a concentration of 1,200 ppm.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 1 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ Slight transient redness was seen in rabbits following application of 0.5 mL to the skin.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 1 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ Mild irritation was seen when CFC-112 was applied dermally to the skin of guinea pigs; no evidence of sensitization was seen.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 1 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ Only slight irritation was seen when CFC-112 was placed in the rabbit eye.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Thienes, C., and T.J. Haley. Clinical Toxicology. 5th ed. Philadelphia: Lea and Febiger, 1972., p. 150
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ Freons (Dichlorodifluoromethane, 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane and 1,1,1,2-Tetrachloro-2,2-Difluoroethane) ... are physiologically inert, except above 3000 ppm; these higher concentrations, administered to rats 4 hours per day for 10 days, caused slight liver and bone marrow injury. That they can be cardiotoxic in mice was shown by ... causing mice to inhale 3 breaths of aerosol propellant, followed by asphyxia for 0.5 to 4 minutes. Marked sinus bradycardia, AV block and death occurred.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists, Inc. Documentation of the Threshold Limit Values and Biological Exposure Indices. 6th ed. Volumes I, II, III. Cincinnati, OH: ACGIH, 1991., p. 1504
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ ... Rats tolerated oral doses of 2 g/kg daily for 23 to 33 days without pathologic changes in any organ. However, when rats were given 5 g/kg daily for 10 days, CFC-112 produced tremors, lethargy, initial weight loss, & reduced hepatic weights accompanied by slight reversible, histopathological changes in the liver. Rats exposed at 10000 ppm for 1.5 to 2 hours showed slight signs of intoxication but no loss of reflexes. Concentrations of 20,000 to 30,000 ppm for 1 to 2.5 hr were fatal & caused severe pulmonary hemorrhages. Exposure at 5000 ppm for 18 hr cause loss of consciousness and death; the lungs of the dead animals were swollen & hemmorhagic. The deaths at these concn are attributed to pulmonary injuries & not to the anesthetic effects of the compound.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists, Inc. Documentation of the Threshold Limit Values and Biological Exposure Indices. 6th ed. Volumes I, II, III. Cincinnati, OH: ACGIH, 1991., p. 1504
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ Repeated exposures at 1000 ppm for 18 hours daily over period of 16 days gave no evidence of pathologic changes in liver, lung or spleen.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ Groups of 10 rats were exposed seven hours a day, five days a week for over six months at 500 or 1,000 ppm of CFC-112. Irritation of the bronchiolar passages was noted at 1,000 ppm, but not at 500 ppm.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ A group of 10 rats was exposed six hours a day, five days a week over four week at an average concentration of 3,000 ppm. The only significant sign of toxicity was a reduction in weight gain.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ ... group of 16 guinea pigs and 4 rabbits /were/ exposed at 500 ppm. Fatty degeneration, necrosis, and regenerative changes of the liver were noted in guinea pigs.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ A group of 16 rats, 10 mice, 2 guinea pigs, and 1 rabbit was exposed at 1,000 ppm CFC-112, six hours daily for 31 days. Gross pathology and histopathology revealed very minor changes in the liver and slight aggravation of the usual type of pneumonitis seen in the rat strain employed.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ A group of four rats each was exposed four hours a day for six days at 5,000 ppm of CFC-112. During exposure, the rats exhibited signs of discomfort, muscular incoordination, and slight narcosis but showed rapid recovery. A subsequent exposure at 2,500 ppm for 14 days showed similar but milder effecs. Pathology did not reveal any significant changes.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/  Groups of male and female rats were given CFC-112 via oral gavage at doses of 125 or 250 mg/kg for three weeks (inhalation equivalent of approximately 110 and 220 ppm, respectively, assuming an air exchange rate of 10 cu m/workday for a 70-kg person). No clinical signs of response or change in body organ weights were seen. Male rats at both doses showed a slight increase in urinary aspartate aminotransferase activity, and males given 250 mg/kg showed increased urinary N-acetyl-beta-D-glucosaminidase activity. No microscopic effects were seen in either the liver or the kidney.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ Rats were fed 2,000 mg/kg for 23 to 33 days without any toxic effects. Pathological examination revealed no adverse changes.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ CFC-112 at 5,000 mg/kg for 10 days resulted in mortality of one of five rats, which exhibited diarrhea, initial body weight loss, tremor, inactivity, a slight increase in liver weight, and slight reversible histological changes in the liver.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Searle, C. E. (ed.). Chemical Carcinogens. ACS Monograph 173. Washington, DC: American Chemical Society, 1976., p. 158
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Chronic Exposure or Carcinogenicity/ FREON 112 was admin to newborn Swiss S mice subcutaneously. Duration of study was 675 days. Dosage was not given. Tumors reported, 1% subcutaneous sarcomas & 5% hepatomas. /From table/

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Chronic Exposure or Carcinogenicity/ A group of 56 neonatal mice was given subcutaneous injections of CFC-112, similar to that of the control group, and were observed for one year. No evidence of a carcinogenic potential was seen.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /GENOTOXICITY/ No increase in dominant lethals was seen in female rats following intraperitoneal injections of either 200 or 1,000 mg/kg for eight weeks prior to mating with untreated male rats.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,2,2-Tetrachloro-1,2-Difluoroethane p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /GENOTOXICITY/ CFC-112 was reported to be weakly positive when tested in Salmonella typhimurium.

soil_absorption_mobility.References: (1) Meylan WM et al; Environ Sci Technol 26: 1560-67 (1992) (2) Swann RL et al; Res Rev 85: 17-28 (1983)]
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: Using a structure estimation method based on molecular connectivity indices(1), the Koc of 1,1,2,2-tetrachloro-1,2-difluoroethane can be estimated to be 200(SRC). According to a classification scheme(2), this estimated Koc value suggests that 1,1,2,2-tetrachloro-1,2-difluoroethane is expected to have moderate mobility in soil.
